snippet: President Obama seems content to let a debate play out in hopes of using the possibility of an aid cutoff to influence the situation without actually pulling the trigger yet.
abstract: Pres Obama's administration is reviewing implications for American aid to Egypt after ouster of Pres Mohamed Morsi; under United States law it has no choice but to cut off financial assistance to country if it determines that he was deposed in military coup; Egyptian officials argue that what happened was not a coup but a popular uprising.
lead_paragraph: President Obama seems content to let a debate play out in hopes of using the possibility of an aid cutoff to influence the situation without actually pulling the trigger yet.

headline.main: A Coup? Or Something Else? $1.5 Billion in U.S. Aid Is on the Line
headline.print_headline: A Coup? Or Something Else? $1.5 Billion in U.S. Aid Is on the Line
